main event: An investigation was made into an alleged sighting of three unidentified airborne objects in Toledo, Ohio on 9 April, 1949.
interesting points: The sighting involved three saucer-like objects that were silver in color and flying at a speed of 40-45 MPH.
The witness could not be located for further investigation, leaving the report inconclusive.
Another report from Walkill, New York described a burning object in the sky, resembling a gliding airplane before vanishing.
The letter from Walkill, New York was acknowledged and incorporated into the study of unidentified aerial phenomena.
A witness described a glowing object in the sky on April [REDACTED], 1949, but the details were not entirely clear due to redactions.
sighted object: three unidentified saucer-like objects in Toledo, Ohio, and a burning airborne object in Walkill, New York
location: Toledo, Ohio and Walkill, New York
witnesses: multiple witnesses in Toledo, Ohio and Walkill, New York
